metadata.title: CVE-2024-26590 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: erofs:fix inconsistent per-file compression format EROFS can select compressionalgorithms on a per-file basis, and each per-file compression algorithmneeds to be marked in the on-disk superblock for initialization. However,syzkaller can generate inconsistent crafted images that use an unsupportedalgorithmtype for specific inodes, e.g. use MicroLZMA algorithmtype evenit's not set in `sbi->available_compr_algs`. This can lead to an unexpected"BUG: kernel NULL pointer dereference" if the corresponding decompressorisn't built-in. Fix this by checking against `sbi->available_compr_algs`for each m_algorithmformat request. Incorrect !erofs_sb_has_compr_cfgspreset bitmap is now fixed together since it was harmless previously.

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
linux-aws package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
linux-azure package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
